author: Gerard Baker
title: The 10-Point.
text:
Good morning,
Tech Tremors
Shares of the biggest names in technology Monday extended their three-week decline, spilling over into other market segments and sending stocks lower in Asia and Europe overnight. The selloff fueled worries that cracks could finally be appearing in what had been one of the past year’s most enduring trades. The so-called FAANG stocks—Facebook, Amazon, Apple, Netflix and Google parent Alphabet—collectively lost $78.7 billion in market value on Monday alone. As the rout intensified, shares of chip makers,...
